title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Friday 2 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: tickets go on sale for champions league .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live this week - come back on monday at 08:00 for more live updates .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain tomorrow
text: dry through the evening with cloud continuing to break for late spells of sunshine , this then leading to a dry night with clear spells .
lows around 12c ( 54f ) .
a dry start to tomorrow with some brighter spells but it 'll soon cloud over and turn wet with outbreaks of heavy rain and gusty winds .
rain looks to mostly clear towards the end of the day .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: youngs ' mouth tweet ?
text: i 'm not sure what ben youngs means by this is it a rugby thing ?
maybe it 's a gloucestershire thing ?
or perhaps he 's just excited about the first game of the season tonight and thought this is how he 'd show it .
good luck tigers !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: expert blames 'baby gadgets ' for changes in children 's development
text: dr rebecca duncombe led the study and says one of the reasons some children are n't physically ready to start school could be a change in lifestyle where children play outside less .
she says another cause could be spending too long in car seats , strollers and other baby gadgets at a young age .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: are four-year-olds ready for school ?
text: researchers at loughborough university say they 've found some four-year-olds are n't physically ready to start school .
specialists tested 45 children at two different schools and found more than expected were having problems with balance and co-ordination .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police plea for more victims to speak out
text: police think there could be more victims of butterworth who have n't yet come forward

`` his victims have shown tremendous courage in coming forward and talking about his crimes and i hope they may now be able to begin new chapters in their lives , finally knowing that he has been held accountable for his actions .
i believe there could be more victims of butterworth , and i would urge anyone who thinks they may have been abused by him to come forward and contact leicestershire police . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: countesthorpe man jailed for historical sex offences
text: a 70-year-old man has been sentenced to a total of 11 years in prison after being found guilty of sexual offences against two children .
graham butterworth , of lewis way in countesthorpe , was found guilty of 10 offences against two boys aged 14 and 15 dating back to the 1980s .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hopelessly devoted to oll
text: so if you have a boy and a girl in the east midlands under one , they 're most likely to be called , ahem , olivia and oliver
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: top baby names revealed
text: disappointed to see 2015 's most popular baby names in england and wales and not find dave in the top 10 .
the office of national statistics has revealed that oliver is in fact the most popular boy 's name overall .
amelia is the most popular girl 's name overall but here in the east midlands , it 's a different story - olivia is at number one .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: deliberations to continue on manslaughter charge
text: the jury heard mohammed hirsi , then 25 , delivered the fatal blow to the heart of mr fyfe , 47 , but the prosecution alleges mr jogee `` egged on '' hirsi while standing on the doorstep of the property in the rowlatts hill area .
jogee denies both murder and manslaughter .
jurors will return to court on monday to continue deliberations on the manslaughter charge .

documents.title: paul fyfe murder : ameen jogee found not guilty
text: a 27-year-old charged over the death of an ex-police officer has been cleared of murder .
ameen jogee was charged with murder and the alternative charge of manslaughter over the death of father-of-three paul fyfe , who was stabbed at the home of his girlfriend in leicester in june 2011 .
the jury at nottingham crown court returned a not guilty verdict to murder after more than 13 hours of deliberations .

documents.title: robbery and assault in beaumont leys
text: a family have been robbed and assaulted at a park on tilling road in leicester known as orange park .
it happened on monday 22 august .
the family were out with their dog when an argument broke out between them and a group of men .
a woman was then threatened with a knife and had her mobile phone taken .
a man was also threatened and had his cheek fractured in an assault .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : players have cars resprayed
text: on our facebook page you 've been telling us what you think about some leicester city players having their bmw gifts changed from blue to black
alexander smith says : `` in truth they were n't even the right blue anyway looks like they play for the cov . ''
leigh spencer says : `` just as long as none of them go for a red paint job , would n't sit well with the fans . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: leicester pride : coming out memories
text: we 've been hearing some of your `` coming out '' stories ahead of leicester pride
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coal usage decades ago still causing respiratory conditions
text: if you grow up in leicester over the past 60 years your chance of dying from a respiratory disease is 79 % higher than other places apparently .
the study shows that people who were exposed to heavy coal use in the home as children are still prone to breathing problems now .
coal usage was 2.5 times higher in leicester than in other areas - hence the unfortunate long-term legacy .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dead rubber match for musa
text: leicester city striker ahmed musa could feature for nigeria later when they face tanzania in an africa cup of nations qualifier .
the match is n't hugely important as neither side is able to qualify .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: fazakerley signs leics professional deal
text: leicestershire have handed 17-year-old bowler will fazakerley a 12-month first professional contract .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: same sex couples 'more accepted '
text: radio leicester has been speaking to someone from leicester lgbt centre ahead of leicester pride about how things have changed
`` it is becoming more and more common that you can walk down the streets hand in hand with your boyfriend or girlfriend and there are fewer comments .
however the prejudice does still exist out there in society . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester to celebrate equality and diversity
text: this is the 8th year of leicester pride - if you do n't know much about the festival it celebrates equality and diversity for the lgbt community of leicester .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands expected for leicester pride
text: get your rainbow flags at the ready because tomorrow is leicester pride
thousands of people are expected in the city for the event .
there 'll be a parade through the centre leading to the festival site on victoria park .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: family struggling to cope with attacks on pony centre
text: pony rescue has been targeted 11 times in the past nine months .
it 's a family charity run by craig and vicky thompson .
craig says : `` we 've got enough funding to keep us going until the end of november .
we may end up closing by christmas if we get hit by any more events that cost us money .
it will be heartbreaking to have to give up on everything we 've done . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : mp gives first interview since being sacked from cabinet
text: here 's jim davis ' full interview with loughborough mp nicky morgan talking about losing her job in the cabinet , brexit , education and local campaigns
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: vandals could force pony rescue centre to close
text: a sad story now - especially if you 're a big fan of ponies .
a sanctuary set up in bagworth to help neglected and injured ponies could have to close because it keeps getting vandalised .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds oppose lutterworth homes plan
text: more than 600 people have now signed an online petition to stop thousands of new homes being built near lutterworth .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: olympic star shares words of wisdom
text: here 's max whitlock with some of the gymnasts at the school games in loughborough

he was there yesterday and told competitors : `` this is your mini olym so enjoy it , go out there and do your very best and if you make any mistakes you 've got plenty more time , as you 're still young , so just enjoy it and take it all in . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police catch illegal fisherman
text: together we caught 8 anglers fishing without a rod licence .
they could now face a max .
fine of £ 2,500 @ twitterid
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : former tigers in action for new clubs
text: in other rugby action tonight newcastle host sale with the former leicester tigers winger vereniki goneva starting for the falcons and ex-tigers number 8 laurence pearce starting for the sharks .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: tigers prepare for season opener
text: leicester tigers start their premiership season tonight with a match away at gloucestershire .
richard cockerill has described it as `` a big start '' to the new campaign .
the tigers boss says it 's important that they get it right tonight .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: games act as stepping stone to olym
text: olympians such as max whitlock have been at the school games and many of these youngsters will go on to represent team gb at the next olym
i was told a fascinating fact if school games was a country , it would come 17th in the olympic medals table .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: fatal crash in leicestershire
text: sad to hear a 37-year-old man died in that crash near countesthorpe early this morning .
it was a crash between a car and a lorry at the junction of cosby lane , lutterworth road and shuttleworth lane .
the man killed was the driver of the car .
the lorry driver just has minor injuries .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: excitement in loughborough for four days of sport
text: as you walk around campus there are students from schools all wearing school games tracksuits .
there 's cheering and music coming from the games and a central stage area where a glamorous opening ceremony has been held .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: cricket : foxes sign academy graduate
text: leicestershire have given a 17-year-old academy graduate his first professional contract at the club .
will fazakerley has signed a deal for the 2017 season .
the club describe him as `` a tall pace bowler who is also a highly capable batsman '' .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: school games start in loughborough
text: the olym have now been and gone so now it 's time to turn of the stars of the future .
it 's the start of the school games where more than 1,500 young athletes compete across 12 sports .
it 's happening in loughborough over the next four days .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: engineers working to repair pipe
text: severn trent says the burst water pipe on church street in oakham could be affecting up to 100 properties in the area .
it says teams are working to get the pipe fixed and everything back to normal `` as quickly as possible '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burst water pipe in oakham
text: customers in oakham may experience supply issues due to a burst in church street .
please see link for more info :
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes go back to black
text: they may play in blue but it seems some of the leicester city players are n't so keen on the colour .
foxes stars were given a blue bmw by the club after winning the premier league but some have chosen to have it repainted black
to be fair they did have a black away shirt last season .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roads reopen after crashes
text: lutterworth road in cosby has now reopened after a major crash overnight .
desford crossroads has also reopened after a crash this morning where a woman had to be cut from a car on its side .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: champions league tickets on sale
text: tickets for leicester city 's three away matches in the group stages of the champions league have gone on sale this morning but are expected to sell out very quickly .
only 1,400 tickets are available for the match against club brugge on 14 september .
there 's 1,900 for the match against fc copenhagen in november and 2,500 for december 's match against fc porto .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: morgan reflects on cabinet exit
text: `` the ability now to speak from the back benches , to represent my constituents and spend time with my family is something i 'm really going to enjoy . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
